page.title: 11BULL BREEDING/M.M.B.
page.content: The Milk Marketing Board has set up a bull rearing farm near Sheldon Manor. The young bulls are used at their nearby artificial insemination station when they are mature. Adult bulls also rest at the farm between spells of duty at the A.I. centre. Both beef and dairy bulls are kept for A.I. purposes and this reflects the growing trend for milk producers to sell their calves as beef animals shortly after birth. Beef calves provide a quick extra income for dairy farmers following the introduction of milk quotas by the E.E.C. in 1984. The A.I. services of the M.M.B. are now available to all farmers.The Chippenham bull breeding farm is part of a national network.
